skill.name: aws-sso-login
skill.description: Authenticate to AWS using Single Sign-On (SSO). Use when AWS CLI operations require SSO authentication or when SSO session has expired.
skill.summary: Authenticate to AWS using Single Sign-On (SSO). Use when AWS CLI operations require SSO authenticati...
skill.author: Daisuke897

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation with no executable code. It describes standard AWS SSO authentication procedures and poses no security risks.

content.value_statement: AWS SSO sessions expire after 8-12 hours, blocking CLI access. This skill automates the re-authentication process with proper profile handling.
actual_capabilities: Triggers AWS SSO login command with specified profile
Supports custom profile configuration per project
limitations: Requires browser for authentication (cannot be fully automated)
Needs pre-configured AWS CLI v2 and SSO setup
Session duration limited by AWS SSO configuration
Network access to SSO endpoint required

use_cases.title: Daily AWS access workflow
use_cases.description: Automate morning authentication to AWS accounts via SSO before running infrastructure commands

use_cases.title: Session refresh for long deployments
use_cases.description: Refresh expired SSO sessions during extended deployment or maintenance windows

use_cases.title: Switch between AWS accounts
use_cases.description: Quickly authenticate to different AWS accounts using various SSO profiles

prompt_templates.title: Basic SSO login
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the aws-sso-login skill to authenticate with my default AWS profile

prompt_templates.title: Specific profile login
prompt_templates.prompt: Authenticate to AWS SSO using the profile 'production-account'

prompt_templates.title: Check current identity
prompt_templates.prompt: After SSO login, run aws sts get-caller-identity to confirm which account I'm authenticated to

prompt_templates.title: Assume role after SSO
prompt_templates.prompt: First authenticate via SSO, then assume the CloudFormation deployment role for account 123456789012

output_examples.input: Authenticate to AWS SSO using profile 'web-hosting'
output: Please complete authentication in the browser...

best_practices: Document default profile names in project README for consistency across team
Check session expiration before long-running operations to avoid mid-process failures
Use specific profiles per environment (dev, staging, prod) for better access control
anti_patterns: Hardcoding profile names in skill invocations - use project configuration instead
Attempting to automate browser authentication - SSO requires manual interaction
Ignoring session expiration warnings - always refresh before critical operations

faq.question: Which AWS CLI versions support SSO?
faq.answer: AWS CLI v2 or later is required for SSO support. Version 1.x does not include SSO functionality.

faq.question: How long do SSO sessions last?
faq.answer: Sessions typically expire after 8-12 hours depending on your organization's AWS SSO configuration.

faq.question: Can this work in headless environments?
faq.answer: Use the --no-browser flag to get a manual URL, but browser authentication is still required.

faq.question: Is my authentication data secure?
faq.answer: Credentials are stored locally in AWS CLI cache and never transmitted to external services.

faq.question: What if authentication fails?
faq.answer: Check your SSO configuration in ~/.aws/config and verify network access to AWS SSO endpoints.

faq.question: How does this compare to aws-azure-login?
faq.answer: This uses native AWS SSO while aws-azure-login is specifically for Azure AD integration with AWS.
